ygData.subject: Re: Testament of Vanear, for research
ygData.msgSnippet: The name of the NPC in Surefall is Ran Walker.
ygData.messageBody:
The name of the NPC in Surefall is Ran Walker.

On Monday, May 17, 1999 6:57 PM, William Ross Cardon II [SMTP:wrcardon@...] wrote:
> From: "William Ross Cardon II" <wrcardon@...>
>
> Yes, you can camp with the Testament.
>
> I have also have yet to travel to Highpass. However, I have seen an NPC in
> surefall (at the entrance) with the first name Ran. I will be traveling to
> Highpass soon (16th level Wizard) and will keep you up dated.
>
> This is probably only a quest, and not research related.. i am sorry if it
> is not and have clogged your mailboxes. :)
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <duffjc@...>
> To: <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
> Sent: Monday, May 17, 1999 2:22 PM
> Subject: [EQ_spell_research] Testament of Vanear, for research
>
>
> > From: duffjc@...
> >
> > I have gone on the same quest. A Paladin (npc)in Erudin asks you to go on
> quest to find the Teatamnet of Vanear.
> > An enchantress in Erudin talks to you about her brother Moodoro Findhorn.
> How he had been slated for execution for selling the magical water of the
> vasty deep to a npc in Qeynos at Crow's Inn called Flynn. She wants you to
> find Flynn and Moodoro and get the water, then she will poison it and you
> return it to Flynn. (haven't done this quest yet fully though, because I
> can't get Flynn to talk to me.)
> >
> > Anyhow, sorry about the side tangent but, You locate Moodoro in Qeynos.
> When you ask him about the Testamnet of Vanear he will sell it to you for
> 2gp and change. Thus far I have come as well and need to venture to High
> Hold in search of the holder of the 2 pages Ran the Librarian. Seeing as
> how everyone and their dog talks about getting slaughtered when they go to
> High Hold, I don't think I will be finishing this quest for at least a
> couple more lvls.
> >
> > Although, I am very interested to see how this Quest turns out, and if you
> can use the Testament for any other purpose than delivering it back to the
> Paladin in Erudin. It would be great if it allowed you some new spells or
> something.
> >
> > I do think though, if you camp that the Testament will disappear from your
> inventory (correct me if I am wrong).
> >
> > If anyone else has more info on this topic I would be greatly thankful.
> >
> > Thanks in advance,
> >
> > Dason Falth 7th Wizard
> > Karana
> >
> > Message: 14
> > Date: Sun, 16 May 1999 16:40:08 -0700
> > From: "William Ross Cardon II" <wrcardon@...>
> > Subject: Testament of Vanear, for research.
> >
> > I have acquired a book called the Testament of Vanear as part of a
> quest. It is
> > missing two pages which a NPC named Ran (Librarian in High Hold)
> supposedly
> > stole. It appears that if these two pages are acquired and combined in
> the
> > Testament that you will get a working copy of the Testament of Vanear.
> >
> > I was wondering if this was a book for research, or it had another
> purpose.
> >
> > Thanks in advance.
> >
